text: What should you do if you receive a suspicious email or message asking for personal details?
If someone online asks for your home address, what should you do?
What should you do if someone sends you a link claiming you won a prize?
If a friend sends you a message asking for your password, what should you do?
What action should you take if you see someone being bullied online?
If someone asks to meet you in person after talking online, what should you do?
What should you do if an unknown account starts messaging you frequently?
How should you respond if someone posts something upsetting about you online?
What should you do if a website asks for your personal information without explaining why?
If someone shares inappropriate content with you online, what is the right course of action?
What should you do if someone you don't know sends you a friend request?
How should you react if a message makes you feel uncomfortable or unsafe?
You receive an email saying you've won a free phone but must enter your credit card details to claim it. What should you do?
A stranger online asks you to send a picture of yourself. What should you do?
Someone sends you a message saying they are from your bank and need your password to verify your account. What should you do?
You see a post online spreading false information about someone in your school. What should you do?
An online gaming friend youâ€™ve never met in real life asks for your phone number. What should you do?
You come across a website that asks you to enter personal information to access free games. What should you do?
A classmate shares a funny but mean-spirited meme about another student. What should you do?
You find a website selling very cheap branded clothes that looks suspicious. What should you do?
A pop-up ad appears claiming your computer has a virus and asks you to download a program to fix it. What should you do?
You receive a message from an unknown number asking you to click a link to claim a prize. What should you do?
Your teacher sends you a message about your homework. What should you do?
A trusted friend shares a link to a school project. What should you do?
Your parent asks for your help to set up a new email account. What should you do?
Your school sends you a reminder about an upcoming event. What should you do?
Your sports coach sends you the schedule for your next match. What should you do?
A family member shares a picture of your recent vacation. What should you do?
Your teacher emails you feedback on your classwork. What should you do?
Your friend sends you a funny meme they found online. What should you do?
Your school principal sends an announcement about safety guidelines. What should you do?
Your trusted friend sends you a study resource for an upcoming test. What should you do?
Your school librarian emails you a list of recommended books for your class. What should you do?
Your classmate sends you a link to a study guide for an upcoming test. What should you do?
Your music teacher sends a schedule for the school concert rehearsals. What should you do?
A science club leader shares an online form to sign up for an upcoming event. What should you do?
Your sports team sends a message about an updated practice schedule. What should you do?
Your teacher sends a reminder about an assignment deadline. What should you do?
Your school nurse emails important health tips for flu season. What should you do?
Your cousin shares a fun educational game link from a trusted website. What should you do?
Your school principal announces a new rule about online safety during computer lab hours. What should you do?
Your parents send you a message reminding you about your bedtime. What should you do?
